How to rescue a freezed Linux? 1. Ctrl + Alt + Backspace 2. ‘Alt + SysRq + K’ . For most desktop, it means ‘Alt + PrintScreen (possibly together with the ‘Fn‘ button) + K’ 3. Press and hold Alt + SysRq, then one by one, press and release the following characters in the respective order: ‘R’ ‘E’ ‘I’ ‘S’ ‘U’ ‘B’. The system will perform a series of tasks and finally reboot the computer
